refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a string description of the last connect error

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The mysqli_connect_error function is identical to the corresponding mysqli_connect_errno function in every way, except instead of returning an integer error code the mysqli_connect_error function will return a string representation of the last error to occur for the last mysqli_connect call. If no error has occured, this function will return an empty string.

refsect1.title: Return values
refsect1.para: A string that describes the error. An empty string if no error occurred.

example.title: mysqli_connect_error sample
example.programlisting:
<?php

$link = @mysqli_connect("localhost", "nonexisting_user", "");

if (!$link) {
    printf("Can't connect to localhost. Error: %s\n", mysqli_connect_error());
}
?>
